page.title: 03Apple Orchards
page.content: In the 66 acres of apple orchard around West Bradley House 22 different kinds of eating apples are grown.The most popular apple is the Cox. The business was started 100 years ago.2 full time staff are employed and additional seasonal staff.There is a small area where the public can pick their own. Potash is used as a fertiliser and the trees are sprayed once a fortnight from April to July to protect them from scab. In a good season the orchards yield between 100 and 200 tons of apples. Some are sold at West Bradley House. but most are sold nationally through Bristol Market. They are sold for 8p to 25p a pound. 30 acres are given to cider apples. These are sold to Showerings at Shepton Mallet.
